original_title: Sri Lanka Hambantota Port oil says bunker volumes grow to 520,000MT
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s China-backed Hambantota Port said its bunker fuel volumes grew six fold to 520,000 metric tonnes in the first six months of 2023.
From January to June 2023, 143 vessel had called at the port compared to only 50 vessels in the first half of last year.

“Marine fuel bunkers make up a large percentage of the throughput we have achieved so far and we are seeing the numbers steadily increasing,” Tissa Wickramasinghe, Chief Operating Officer of Hambantota International Port Group said in a statement.
“This is mainly due to the close collaboration we have with our bunkering partner Sinopec Fuel Oil Lanka (SFOL).”
“Our increased throughput has also had a positive impact on the local community as well as local bunker suppliers.”
MV Swarna Godavari had unloaded 31,500 metric tons of VLSFO at the port, taking volumes beyond the half million mark to 520,000 metric tonnes. (Colombo/July26/2023)
